title: How to Write a Basic Python Program

steps.headline: Open the Terminal.
steps.description: On Linux, you can press the Alt button to open a search bar. Type "terminal" and click on Terminal.

steps.headline: Know the commands.
steps.description:
Terminal commands are shown in this document as:
command -options filename.ext


sudo apt-get install build-essential

The "sudo" command gives permission to the terminal to modify your computer. This is necessary to install any program. You will be required to enter your password. The "apt-get install" command tells the computer to install the package "build-essential" which is required to install Python. sudo apt-get install libreadline-gplv2-dev libncursesw5-dev libssl-dev libsqlite3-dev tk-dev libgdbm-dev libc6-dev libbz2-dev

These are programs that Python uses to run correctly. They are also known as “dependencies”.

steps.headline: Download the latest version of Python from the Internet.
steps.description:
Use the following command:
cd ~/Downloads/

The "cd" command changes to the correct working directory so the computer can find and put programs in the right place. wget http://python.org/ftp/python/2.7.5/Python-2.7.5.tgz

steps.headline: Decompress the Python file using the following command:
steps.description: tar -xvf Python-2.7.5.tgz  cd Python-2.7.5  Once again, we need to change the working directory. This time, we change to the newly created Python directory.

steps.headline: Use the ./configure command checks your computer to ensure you have all the necessary components to install Python.
steps.description: It will alert you of any critical errors. ./configure

steps.headline: Use the make command.
steps.description: It compiles the source code and creates the executables. make

steps.headline: Move the applications and libraries.
steps.description: With the following command, all of the applications and libraries associated with Python are moved into the correct places on your computer. sudo make install

steps.headline: Open a text editor.
steps.description: Any text editor that can save files with a ".py" extension will do. Ubuntu 12.04 or greater is packaged with the Gedit editor.

steps.headline: Type print 'Hello, World!'
steps.description: In Python, whatever is enclosed in quotes after the word print will be printed out to the screen.

steps.headline: Save the file as "hello_world.py.
steps.description: Be careful that the file is not saved as "hello_world.py.txt".

steps.headline: Navigate to the directory where "hello_world.py" is located.
steps.description: Remember to use the "cd" command to change directories. If you need a list of all subdirectories at your current location, use the "ls" command. "ls" stands for "list subdirectories".

On Linux, you can press the Alt button to open a search bar.
Type "terminal" and click on Terminal.
Know the commands.

Terminal commands are shown in this document as:
command -options filename.ext


sudo apt-get install build-essential

This is necessary to install any program.
You will be required to enter your password.
The "apt-get install" command tells the computer to install the package "build-essential" which is required to install Python.

sudo apt-get install libreadline-gplv2-dev libncursesw5-dev libssl-dev libsqlite3-dev tk-dev libgdbm-dev libc6-dev libbz2-dev

These are programs that Python uses to run correctly.
They are also known as “dependencies”.
Download the latest version of Python from the Internet.

cd ~/Downloads/

wget http://python.org/ftp/python/2.7.5/Python-2.7.5.tgz Decompress the Python file using the following command: tar -xvf Python-2.7.5.tgz  cd Python-2.7.5  Once again, we need to change the working directory.

Navigate to the directory where "hello_world.py" is located.
Remember to use the "cd" command to change directories.
